1. Basic research and analysis of educationalmdio and television

and place of educationalbroadcasting within the framework of
educational institutions as seen by school administrators and
educational leaders.
2. Large scale investigation o f the role and purposes which might
be served by an educational broadcasting station as revealed
through a sizable and significant sampling of consumer or
audience needs or preferences in two or three typical and rep¬
resentative areas or ccmniunities.
3. Detailed analysis of the most effective methods of coordinating
a regular university faculty and staff into television programming
and broadcasting activities. This analysis and study would be
done in cooperation with the recognized accrediting agencies and
association such as the North Central Association and the Adult
Education Association. Additional problems for study and analysis
would be those of credit allocation, credit transfer, teaching
credit, staff compensation, etc.
4. A Sociological study of a pre-educational station community and
post educational station developments.
